ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I mastered three new tenses and learned about certain grammar agreements (subject-verb) as well as a lot of useful vocabulary.
SPAN 110 is a great class to begin the Spanish language, especially with Professor Alexandrov.
An introduction to a wide array of vocabulary and grammatical concepts and an ability to both understand and utilize them in conversation.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths are the teachers' dedication and patience when teaching Spanish a weakness or a part I personally see no benefit in is the culture learning.
Strengths--great teachers Weaknesses-- sometimes moves too quickly on grammar subjects

While the course claims to be at an elementary level it is designed for students who already have experience with the language. To take more time going over grammatical points and initially explaining them in english would also be helpful.
I think too much material is covered in what should be an introductory class. It should focus more on building a strong basis in grammar, and less on vocabulary about weddings.
It moves very fast, which makes it difficult to process and implement the information we are learning.

Strengths: the variety and utility of activities each class; the conversational nature of the class; the trust the teacher put in us towards understanding instruction in Spanish Weaknesses: Went a bit fast - more review would help solidify knowledge of grammar and vocabulary
There should not have been a test the day after we came back from spring break, we should have been tested on the material before we left.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes because I think Spanish is an important language to learn and the teachers here, well at least at my teacher, really facilitate the learning process. You get a lot of feedback on speaking, writing and reading. The only downside is the amount of reading practice our homework assignments felt more like busy-work except for the cat story that was the best assignment by far.
Definitely would recommend. Grading is fair, and you actually learn Spanish.
I would, but explain to them that it is set at a very accelerated pace.
Yes, especially if it is taught by Professor Alexandrov.
Yes, good for a language requirement.
